channel.title: 60-second Positive Parenting - Audio
channel.description: Some days, even parents deserve a timeout. The 60-second Positive Parenting series provides moms and dads with brief, timely refreshers on a growing family of parenting topics. The series is hosted by child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, who draws upon his expertise as the director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, as well as his experiences as a father. Dr. Putt also coordinates the hospital's Positive Parenting Program, which offers proven strategies and techniques to manage a child's behavior in caring and constructive ways.
channel.itunes:author: Akron Children's Hospital
channel.itunes:summary: Some days, even parents deserve a timeout. The 60-second Positive Parenting series provides moms and dads with brief, timely refreshers on a growing family of parenting topics. The series is hosted by child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, who draws upon his expertise as the director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, as well as his experiences as a father. Dr. Putt also coordinates the hospital's Positive Parenting Program, which offers proven strategies and techniques to manage a child's behavior in caring and constructive ways.

item.title: Motivators and Rewards - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: While a trip to the local fast food restaurant or the renting the latest video game may seem like great rewards for a school-age child, the promotion of poor eating and activity habits may actually do more harm than good. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, encourages parents to pick rewards that promote healthy attitudes and lifestyles in their children.
item.itunes:summary: While a trip to the local fast food restaurant or the renting the latest video game may seem like great rewards for a school-age child, the promotion of poor eating and activity habits may actually do more harm than good. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, encourages parents to pick rewards that promote healthy attitudes and lifestyles in their children.

item.title: Managing Money - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: From balancing a check book to maintaining a household budget, managing money can be a challenging yet important skill for children to master. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses some ways that parents can share a wealth of knowledge about their knowledge of wealth.
item.itunes:summary: From balancing a check book to maintaining a household budget, managing money can be a challenging yet important skill for children to master. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses some ways that parents can share a wealth of knowledge about their knowledge of wealth.

item.title: Sharing - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: From splitting a drippy ice cream cone to taking turns with the family car, sharing can provide children with a lifetime of benefits. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses how parents can use role modeling and other methods to teach and reinforce this valuable skill.
item.itunes:summary: From splitting a drippy ice cream cone to taking turns with the family car, sharing can provide children with a lifetime of benefits. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses how parents can use role modeling and other methods to teach and reinforce this valuable skill.

item.title: Homework Involvement - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: From a page of trinomials that need to be factored to a chapter on reconstruction after the civil war, kids really do bring home a lot of homework. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses ways parents can help out without adding to their child’s frustration.
item.itunes:summary: From a page of trinomials that need to be factored to a chapter on reconstruction after the civil war, kids really do bring home a lot of homework. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses ways parents can help out without adding to their child’s frustration.

item.title: Dating Age - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: While there may be no set “rules” regarding the best age to start dating, child development research may offer parents a few guidelines. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, shares these guidelines, as well as the importance of adult supervision when the doorbells start ringing.
item.itunes:summary: While there may be no set “rules” regarding the best age to start dating, child development research may offer parents a few guidelines. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, shares these guidelines, as well as the importance of adult supervision when the doorbells start ringing.

item.title: Staying Focused - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Learning to stay focused on a task may be as simple as removing distractions like televisions, smart phones and iPods. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses distractions and other factors that can make or break a child’s focus.
item.itunes:summary: Learning to stay focused on a task may be as simple as removing distractions like televisions, smart phones and iPods. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses distractions and other factors that can make or break a child’s focus.

item.title: Memory - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Missing homework assignments add up fast on the report card, especially when the only excuse is “I forgot.” In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses checklists, mnemonics and other ways to enhance memory.
item.itunes:summary: Missing homework assignments add up fast on the report card, especially when the only excuse is “I forgot.” In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses checklists, mnemonics and other ways to enhance memory.

item.title: Impulse Control - 60 Second Positive Parenting
item.description: The urge to blurt out an answer in class or explain to mom why the last cupcake is missing is often a source of trouble for kids when they don’t take a moment to consider their response. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses ways that parents and teachers can encourage children to think before acting or responding.
item.itunes:summary: The urge to blurt out an answer in class or explain to mom why the last cupcake is missing is often a source of trouble for kids when they don’t take a moment to consider their response. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses ways that parents and teachers can encourage children to think before acting or responding.

item.title: Organization - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Organization is a learned behavior, and parents play an important role in teaching their children this lifelong skill. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, provides some strategies that parents can share with their kids.
item.itunes:summary: Organization is a learned behavior, and parents play an important role in teaching their children this lifelong skill. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, provides some strategies that parents can share with their kids.

item.title: Executive Functioning - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: The cognitive functions that allow us to plan, remember, solve problems and otherwise help us to be organized and successful are collectively known as executive functions. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses the importance of these functions to keeping children organized and on task at school and at home.
item.itunes:summary: The cognitive functions that allow us to plan, remember, solve problems and otherwise help us to be organized and successful are collectively known as executive functions. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses the importance of these functions to keeping children organized and on task at school and at home.

item.title: Note Taking - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Through the use of outlines, abbreviations and other note taking skills, students stand a better chance of capturing the information they’ll likely see again on a quiz or test. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, reviews these and other techniques to help improve a child’s ability to organize and record important information.
item.itunes:summary: Through the use of outlines, abbreviations and other note taking skills, students stand a better chance of capturing the information they’ll likely see again on a quiz or test. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, reviews these and other techniques to help improve a child’s ability to organize and record important information.

item.title: Family Vacations - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Whether you’re packing the kids up for a week at the beach, or stopping by grandma’s for a little Thanksgiving turkey, some advance preparation could help ease the stress of a long car trip and unfamiliar surroundings. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses the benefits of planned stops, multi-purpose packing and a reasonable - yet fun - schedule.
item.itunes:summary: Whether you’re packing the kids up for a week at the beach, or stopping by grandma’s for a little Thanksgiving turkey, some advance preparation could help ease the stress of a long car trip and unfamiliar surroundings. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses the benefits of planned stops, multi-purpose packing and a reasonable - yet fun - schedule.

item.title: Asking for Help - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: While parents may not be handed an instruction manual the day their child is born, there are plenty of resources available to help moms and dads through the rough patches. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses some of the benefits of the Positive Parenting Program, held at the main campus in Akron.
item.itunes:summary: While parents may not be handed an instruction manual the day their child is born, there are plenty of resources available to help moms and dads through the rough patches. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses some of the benefits of the Positive Parenting Program, held at the main campus in Akron.

item.title: Dangerous Teen Games - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Parents walk a fine line when balancing their teen’s desire for privacy versus their parental responsibility to ensure their child is healthy and safe. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses some of the signs that your teens may be engaging in some risky behaviors.
item.itunes:summary: Parents walk a fine line when balancing their teen’s desire for privacy versus their parental responsibility to ensure their child is healthy and safe. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses some of the signs that your teens may be engaging in some risky behaviors.

item.title: The ABCs of Special Education - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: For the parents of a child with special needs, just understanding IEPs, MFEs, and a daunting array of other acronyms may be just the first challenge of many when accessing the education system. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, encourages parents to ask plenty of questions, seek out others with similar concerns and do everything they can to advocate for the needs of their child.
item.itunes:summary: For the parents of a child with special needs, just understanding IEPs, MFEs, and a daunting array of other acronyms may be just the first challenge of many when accessing the education system. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, encourages parents to ask plenty of questions, seek out others with similar concerns and do everything they can to advocate for the needs of their child.

item.title: Halloween Tips and Treats - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Short of becoming a four-armed, four-legged, mind-reading monster with eyes in the back of its head and excellent pumpkin-carving skills, Halloween can present challenges for parents. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, offers a few tips to help ensure the only scares you experience are followed by laughs and smiles.
item.itunes:summary: Short of becoming a four-armed, four-legged, mind-reading monster with eyes in the back of its head and excellent pumpkin-carving skills, Halloween can present challenges for parents. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, offers a few tips to help ensure the only scares you experience are followed by laughs and smiles.

item.title: Parent Teacher Conferences - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: More than just a check on your child’s grades, the parent-teacher conference can be a window to your child’s life outside the home. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents listen to how their child is interacting with others, following directions, and taking steps toward becoming an independent and responsible young adult.
item.itunes:summary: More than just a check on your child’s grades, the parent-teacher conference can be a window to your child’s life outside the home. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents listen to how their child is interacting with others, following directions, and taking steps toward becoming an independent and responsible young adult.

item.title: Sick at School - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: It can sometimes be difficult for parents to distinguish between a child who is sick at school and one who is sick OF school. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents discuss this subject with their kids ahead of time and provide some guidelines for what are really the signs of sickness.
item.itunes:summary: It can sometimes be difficult for parents to distinguish between a child who is sick at school and one who is sick OF school. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents discuss this subject with their kids ahead of time and provide some guidelines for what are really the signs of sickness.

item.title: Poor Hygiene - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Have you ever had one of those days where your teen seems to know everything about everything … except how to take a shower? In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, shares his tips for helping you and your child get off to a “clean” start.
item.itunes:summary: Have you ever had one of those days where your teen seems to know everything about everything … except how to take a shower? In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, shares his tips for helping you and your child get off to a “clean” start.

item.title: Choosing a Daycare - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: From the availability of age-appropriate activities to staff-to-child ratios, there are many considerations when selecting the “right” daycare for your child. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, shares his thoughts on what parents can do to help their child take her first steps into the world.
item.itunes:summary: From the availability of age-appropriate activities to staff-to-child ratios, there are many considerations when selecting the “right” daycare for your child. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, shares his thoughts on what parents can do to help their child take her first steps into the world.

item.title: Grief and Loss - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Discussing the passing of a loved one with their children may present challenges for parents, especially since they are also coping with the news. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends using everyday cues to begin this potentially-difficult conversation.
item.itunes:summary: Discussing the passing of a loved one with their children may present challenges for parents, especially since they are also coping with the news. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends using everyday cues to begin this potentially-difficult conversation.

item.title: Family Pets - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Family pets can be cute and fun, but they are also an opportunity to teach kids about responsibility, trust and other life lessons. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, offers some tips to families whose households may be going to the dogs.
item.itunes:summary: Family pets can be cute and fun, but they are also an opportunity to teach kids about responsibility, trust and other life lessons. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, offers some tips to families whose households may be going to the dogs.

item.title: Swearing - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: What parents say and do before and after a child swears may help determine whether he continues to utter the offending words with any regularity. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, offers a few tips to help curb a child’s urge to %$&#@*.
item.itunes:summary: What parents say and do before and after a child swears may help determine whether he continues to utter the offending words with any regularity. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, offers a few tips to help curb a child’s urge to %$&#@*.

item.title: Team Sports - 60-Second Postive Parenting
item.description: Team sports provide a fun and age-appropriate environment to teach children about sportsmanship, teamwork, fitness and other valuable life lessons. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, encourages parents to help their kids “get in the game.”
item.itunes:summary: Team sports provide a fun and age-appropriate environment to teach children about sportsmanship, teamwork, fitness and other valuable life lessons. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, encourages parents to help their kids “get in the game.”

item.title: Teen Driving - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: When it comes to teens and driving, the guidelines you set for inside the car may be just as important as the rules of the road. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, encourages parents to discuss these expectations with their teens before they get behind the wheel.
item.itunes:summary: When it comes to teens and driving, the guidelines you set for inside the car may be just as important as the rules of the road. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, encourages parents to discuss these expectations with their teens before they get behind the wheel.

item.title: Weight Management - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: From the grocery store to the dinner table, parents can send their children a clear message about managing their weight. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, also stresses the importance of role modeling healthy eating habits.
item.itunes:summary: From the grocery store to the dinner table, parents can send their children a clear message about managing their weight. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, also stresses the importance of role modeling healthy eating habits.

item.title: Toy Clean Up - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Now that we've handled the messy room, it's time to focus on the messes in the rest of the house. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses the community areas of your home and how you can encourage your children to help keep it tidy.
item.itunes:summary: Now that we've handled the messy room, it's time to focus on the messes in the rest of the house. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses the community areas of your home and how you can encourage your children to help keep it tidy.

item.title: Nightmares vs. Night Terrors - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: If you awake in the middle of the night to your child quietly sobbing as they tap your shoulder, it may not be a nightmare that spurred her visit. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses nightmares and night terrors and what parents can do to help put their child at ease.
item.itunes:summary: If you awake in the middle of the night to your child quietly sobbing as they tap your shoulder, it may not be a nightmare that spurred her visit. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses nightmares and night terrors and what parents can do to help put their child at ease.

item.title: Kids Are Like Sharks - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: It may not be a coincidence that your child starts to act up when you start talking on the phone, using the restroom or are otherwise vulnerable to their misbehavior. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, notes that like sharks, kids may be waiting until they sense a little "blood in the water" before they choose to strike.
item.itunes:summary: It may not be a coincidence that your child starts to act up when you start talking on the phone, using the restroom or are otherwise vulnerable to their misbehavior. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, notes that like sharks, kids may be waiting until they sense a little "blood in the water" before they choose to strike.

item.title: Lying - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Even if kids are pretty sure they'll get caught if they lie, they know they'll get caught if they tell the truth. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents make telling the truth more rewarding than lying.
item.itunes:summary: Even if kids are pretty sure they'll get caught if they lie, they know they'll get caught if they tell the truth. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents make telling the truth more rewarding than lying.

item.title: The Great Debate - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Whether it's a later bedtime, a new video game or a trip to the ice cream shop, kids are always ready to debate their parents to get what they want. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, has a sure-fire solution for parents: Don't enter the debate.
item.itunes:summary: Whether it's a later bedtime, a new video game or a trip to the ice cream shop, kids are always ready to debate their parents to get what they want. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, has a sure-fire solution for parents: Don't enter the debate.

item.title: Fireworks Displays - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Fireworks displays can be a real blast for kids of all ages with a little thought and preparation. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, encourages parents to consider the weather, noise, crowds and other factors to ensure the best possible experience for their children.
item.itunes:summary: Fireworks displays can be a real blast for kids of all ages with a little thought and preparation. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, encourages parents to consider the weather, noise, crowds and other factors to ensure the best possible experience for their children.

item.title: Separation Anxiety - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: The most difficult part of taking your child to day care is often ... taking your child to day care. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, offers a few tips to ease the pangs of separation anxiety, even if it's mom and dad who feel it the most.
item.itunes:summary: The most difficult part of taking your child to day care is often ... taking your child to day care. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, offers a few tips to ease the pangs of separation anxiety, even if it's mom and dad who feel it the most.

item.title: Stay Positive - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Finding opportunities to reward instead of punish may be the key to improving your child's behavior. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, says that offering children praise or a small reward for making their bed or cleaning up their plate may encourage many repeat performances.
item.itunes:summary: Finding opportunities to reward instead of punish may be the key to improving your child's behavior. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, says that offering children praise or a small reward for making their bed or cleaning up their plate may encourage many repeat performances.

item.title: Internet Safety - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: From researching a homework assignment to reaching out to friends far and near, the internet has altered the everyday lives of our children. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents provide their children with guidelines for the safe and appropriate use of this valuable tool.
item.itunes:summary: From researching a homework assignment to reaching out to friends far and near, the internet has altered the everyday lives of our children. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents provide their children with guidelines for the safe and appropriate use of this valuable tool.

item.title: Why Are My Children So Different? - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: While it usually takes a trip to the local high school to see jocks, nerds, goths, preppies, and other sub-cultures of teens in their natural environment, some families may just have to sit down at the dinner table. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses why children develop different interests and lifestyles, as well as what parents can do to encourage their kids to reach their full potential.
item.itunes:summary: While it usually takes a trip to the local high school to see jocks, nerds, goths, preppies, and other sub-cultures of teens in their natural environment, some families may just have to sit down at the dinner table. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses why children develop different interests and lifestyles, as well as what parents can do to encourage their kids to reach their full potential.

item.title: Whining - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Whether they want the latest electronic gadget, or just a little attention, most kids seem to be well-versed in the art of fine whining. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents turn a deaf ear until their children are ready to discuss their problems without the baby talk and yelling.
item.itunes:summary: Whether they want the latest electronic gadget, or just a little attention, most kids seem to be well-versed in the art of fine whining. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents turn a deaf ear until their children are ready to discuss their problems without the baby talk and yelling.

item.title: When Not To Step In - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: When it comes to kids and their disputes, the decision to step in or stay out may be a dilemma faced several times each day by many parents. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist, Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses when it may be best to let kids work out problems on their own.
item.itunes:summary: When it comes to kids and their disputes, the decision to step in or stay out may be a dilemma faced several times each day by many parents. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist, Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses when it may be best to let kids work out problems on their own.

item.title: When Do I Step In? - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Letting children settle their disputes can teach valuable life lessons, so when do mom or dad need to "referee" the outcome? In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist, Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, shares a few tips about when to step in.
item.itunes:summary: Letting children settle their disputes can teach valuable life lessons, so when do mom or dad need to "referee" the outcome? In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist, Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, shares a few tips about when to step in.

item.title: The Perfect Parent Trap - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: From becoming a walking wiki of the latest child development research to providing a 24-hour limo service for their kids' activities, what does it take to be the "perfect" parent? In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist, Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, defines "perfect" in ways that will have a greater impact on a child's health and well being, as well as save mom and dad a few trips to the gas pump.
item.itunes:summary: From becoming a walking wiki of the latest child development research to providing a 24-hour limo service for their kids' activities, what does it take to be the "perfect" parent? In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist, Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, defines "perfect" in ways that will have a greater impact on a child's health and well being, as well as save mom and dad a few trips to the gas pump.

item.title: The Messy Room - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Do you have a hard time remembering if your child has carpet or hardwood floors in her room ... or if she even has a bed? In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, talks about kids and their messy rooms, including the steps parents can take to keep the hoarding to a minimum.
item.itunes:summary: Do you have a hard time remembering if your child has carpet or hardwood floors in her room ... or if she even has a bed? In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, talks about kids and their messy rooms, including the steps parents can take to keep the hoarding to a minimum.

item.title: Talking to Your Kids About Sex - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Having "The Talk" may be easier and better for both parent and child alike if it is broken up into a series of smaller talks. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents take advantage of everyday situations to provide their children with simple, accurate and age-appropriate responses to questions about sex.

In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents take advantage of everyday situations to provide their children with simple, accurate and age-appropriate responses to questions about sex.

item.title: Screen Time - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Does your child have a warm glow on his face, even though it doesn't seem like he has seen the sun in days? In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist, Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, talks about what parents can do to help their kids strike a healthy balance between the real and virtual worlds.

In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist, Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, talks about what parents can do to help their kids strike a healthy balance between the real and virtual worlds.

item.title: Reduce the Volume - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: When it comes to resolving family conflicts, it may take a little silence to get your voice heard. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, talks about how the key to keep your kids from tuning you out may involve turning down the volume.
item.itunes:summary: When it comes to resolving family conflicts, it may take a little silence to get your voice heard. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, talks about how the key to keep your kids from tuning you out may involve turning down the volume.

item.title: Mind Your Manners - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: "Please" and "thank you" are a great place to start when teaching your child the importance of manners. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses how it's never too early to teach children the social skills that will last a lifetime.

In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses how it's never too early to teach children the social skills that will last a lifetime.

item.title: Kids and Cell Phones - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: The decision to give a child a cell phone can be a tough call for parents. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, offers guidelines for when a child might be ready to have a cell phone, as well as how and where their fingers should do the walking.
item.itunes:summary: The decision to give a child a cell phone can be a tough call for parents. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, offers guidelines for when a child might be ready to have a cell phone, as well as how and where their fingers should do the walking.

item.title: 60-Second Positive Parenting - An Introduction
item.description: Some days, even parents deserve a timeout. The 60-second Positive Parenting series provides moms and dads with brief, timely refreshers on a growing family of parenting topics. The series is hosted by child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, who draws upon his expertise as the director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, as well as his experiences as a father. Dr. Putt also coordinates the hospital's Positive Parenting Program, which offers proven strategies and techniques to manage a child's behavior in caring and constructive ways.
item.itunes:summary: Some days, even parents deserve a timeout. The 60-second Positive Parenting series provides moms and dads with brief, timely refreshers on a growing family of parenting topics. The series is hosted by child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, who draws upon his expertise as the director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, as well as his experiences as a father. Dr. Putt also coordinates the hospital's Positive Parenting Program, which offers proven strategies and techniques to manage a child's behavior in caring and constructive ways.

item.title: Creating a Safe and Engaging Environment - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Keeping your kids safe may be as simple as seeing your house through the eyes of a child or teen, including where you put the computer. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses the steps parents can take to protect their children from everyday hazards in the real and virtual worlds.

In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, discusses the steps parents can take to protect their children from everyday hazards in the real and virtual worlds.

item.title: Electronics Overload - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: Between television, computers, smart phones and other gadgets, electronics have invaded every part of our children's lives. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents restore a little balance by finding opportunities for their children to "unplug."

In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, recommends that parents restore a little balance by finding opportunities for their children to "unplug."

item.title: Fire Setting - 60-Second Positive Parenting
item.description: The burning desire to play with fire can be a serious concern for children and parents alike. In this segment of 60-Second Positive Parenting, child psychologist Geoffrey Putt, PsyD, director of parenting and family support services at Akron Children's Hospital, talks about what parents can do to temper this curiosity, including the importance of setting a good example for their children to follow.
